alert.note: Alert for Highland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 7:21AM EDT until September 05 at 2:51PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Fayette County Ohio, Northern Highland County Ohio, and Eastern Clinton County Ohio. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 720 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Washington Court House, Hillsboro, Sabina, Lynchburg, Leesburg, New Vienna, Jeffersonville, Bloomingburg, Russell, Staunton, Good Hope, Highland, St. Martin, Milledgeville, Octa, Lees Creek, East Monroe, New Martinsburg, Jasper Mills and Reesville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
